column4: how to get list of my hard drives I have 3 HDD but one hdd doesn't has any partitions but in fdisk -l doesn't show it
sudo lshw. That'll list all hardware connected to the motherboard
Flare183:I found it what does it mean ? > *-disk UNCLAIMED  description: ATA Disk   product: Maxtor 6V160E0
That's the HD's
*-disk UNCLAIMED  ?  can add partition on this HDD ?
You should be able too, that is if its not already filled up with them.
means I should have /dev/sd* ? for it ? I can not see in fdisk or cfdisk
Yes you should have a /dev/sd*
Flare183: wow . I open gparted and this hard doesn't show in this app
ok, run dmesg, and look for it
Flare183:it's my output http://codepad.org/oOMsy8iY
I think its sdc
Your third HD is failing
It needs to be replaced or something.
when I connected this hard while boot I've got a lot of ata3.00: status: { DRDY ERR } [ 1245.737332] ata3.00: error: { UNC }
means I can't use it ? and it damaged ?
That's the kernel telling you that the HD is dying/die.
Yes, exactly.
can I low format my HDD
I don't know about that, but you can try.
low level format
I don't know how to do that in Linux either.
